question.title: Kafka java client not honouring logging configuration
question.body:
I have the following in my pom.xml:

        <!--logging-->
         <!--Force JCL and log4j to use SLF4J and Force SLF4j logging to use JUL as the concrete implementation - see https://www.slf4j.org/legacy.html-->
                <dependency><groupId>org.apache.kafka</groupId><artifactId>kafka-streams</artifactId><version>3.6.1</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
                    <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.17</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcl-over-slf4j</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.17</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>log4j-over-slf4j</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.17</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-jdk14</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.17</version>
        </dependency>

I then have a JUL logging configuration file:

handlers = java.util.logging.FileHandler

#5MB files, max 5 files

java.util.logging.FileHandler.pattern = /var/output.log
java.util.logging.FileHandler.limit = 5000000
java.util.logging.FileHandler.level = ALL
java.util.logging.FileHandler.count = 5
java.util.logging.FileHandler.formatter = java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter

# log everything as info for now
.level = INFO

I then run the application:

java -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/app.logging.properties -jar app.jar

However, I am still getting outputs like this in my Standard ERROR output:

[2025-05-06 10:45:23.012] - 546981 INFO [kafka-producer-network-thread | producer-6] --- org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata: [Producer clientId=producer-6] Cluster ID: QDoxYTzkQ86b9RUDpEaS8B
[2025-05-06 10:54:21.233] - 546981 INFO [kafka-producer-network-thread | producer-1] --- org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient: [Producer clientId=producer-1] Node -1 disconnected.

Why are these logs not being sent out to my log file?

--- Updates ---

This only appears to be an issue when I have Camel / SpringBoot Starter in the pom too. Is there a way to force those components to use my logging instead of its own?

question_comments.body: excluding spring-boot-starter-logging doesn't seem to make a difference, nor does getting rid of the camel-log and camel-log-starter jar files
Can you add exclude spring-boot-starter-logging to spring starter and ensure only slf4j-jdk14 is on the classpath to properly route logs to your JUL configuration.
